DataElement.preferredName: Patient Reported Outcome Oral Symptoms Rinse Taste Assessment Likert Scale Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A psychometric scale (0-10, with 0 being Acceptable and 10 being Terrible) for information regarding the Patient Completed Oral Symptoms assessment of the taste of the oral rinse, collected directly from a patient that typically includes subjective feelings regarding symptoms, functions in daily life, physical, mental, emotional, spiritual, and social well being, and satisfaction with his/her health care.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Reported Outcome Oral Symptoms Rinse Taste Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information on the Patient Completed Oral Symptoms assessment of the taste of the oral rinse, collected directly from a patient that typically includes subjective feelings regarding symptoms, functions in daily life, physical, mental, emotional, spiritual, and social well being, and satisfaction with his/her health care.

Property.preferredName: Oral Symptom Rinse Dosage Form Gustation Assessment
Property.preferredDefinition: Of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth.:Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.:A liquid used to cleanse by flushing.:The faculty of taste, distinguishing substances by means of the taste buds.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: Of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.
A solution or suspension intended for irrigation purposes.
The faculty of taste, distinguishing substances by means of the taste buds.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ReferenceDocuments.name: On a scale from 0 to 10, what
ReferenceDocuments.description: On a scale from 0 to 10, what number best describes the TASTE OF THE ORAL RINSE now? (circle one number)
